botanical_details.genus: Solanum can be annuals, perennials, evergreen or deciduous shrubs or twining climbers, with simple or pinnnately lobed leaves and star- or bowl-shaped, 5-lobed flowers with prominent stamens, followed by fleshy fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Start from seed, or buy as small plants, and grow on in a heated greenhouse or on a well-lit windowsill. Can be moved to an unheated greenhouse, or a sunny, sheltered position outdoors, once all risk of frost has passed. Water regularly, feed once the first flowers have set, and provide support. See Tomatoes cultivation for further advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed, or use side shoots as cuttings
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove all side shoots as soon as they develop, and the tip of the plant once it reaches the top of the support, or after six trusses have set
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to glasshouse whitefly and tomato moth
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to a variety of diseases, including tomato blight and tomato leaf mould. See Tomatoes: leaf problems and Tomatoes: stem problems
